name: ext_R2_DiagnosticOrder_event
title: Cross-version Extension for R2.DiagnosticOrder.event for use in FHIR R3
description: This cross-version extension represents DiagnosticOrder.event from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/DiagnosticOrder|1.0.2 for use in FHIR R3.

element.short: A list of events of interest in the lifecycle
element.definition: A summary of the events of interest that have occurred as the request is processed; e.g. when the order was made, various processing steps (specimens received), when it was completed.
element.comment: `DiagnosticOrder.event` has no related element in R3:ProcedureRequest

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.
